Importance
 

     People are easily reached through social avenues.--People are easily reached through the avenues of the social circle. . . . It is highly important that a pastor should mingle much with his people, that he may become acquainted with the different phases of human nature, readily understand the workings of the mind, adapt his teachings to the intellect of his people, and learn that grand charity possessed only by those who closely study the nature and needs of men.--4T 266.
